info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 5 at 3:56PM EDT until July 5 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Florida, including the following county, Pinellas.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Largo, Pinellas Park, Seminole, St. Petersburg, South Highpoint, Bay Pines, Ridgecrest, West And East Lealman, Harbor Bluffs, Feather Sound, Kenneth City, Belleair Bluffs, Belleair Beach, Walsingham Park, Lealman and Sawgrass Lake Park. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
